item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "A lady's imagination is very rapid; it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I sent the club a wire stating, PLEASE ACCEPT MY RESIGNATION. I DON'T WANT TO BELONG TO ANY CLUB THAT WILL ACCEPT ME AS A MEMBER." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Neal Shusterman
Mahathi add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Hate the sin, love the sinner." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Jerry Spinelli
item.description: "I think of the flower in the bud: huddled, compressed, dark. Yet somehow it feels the night, knows moon from sun. It waits...waits." -- Jerry Spinelli

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Thomas Szasz
item.description: "Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse." -- Thomas Szasz

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Mahathi add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein
